media.caption: Wells curves for different relative humiditie

text.headline: W. F. Wells founding the droplet nuclei science in 1934
text.text: Wells thought that droplets smaller a certain size would quickly evaporate, leaving a dry residue that drifts in the air. Since droplets from an infected person may contain infectious bacteria or viruses, these processes influence transmission of respiratory diseases

media.caption: capture from the full report - see 'airborne' in text

text.headline: 1 kid infects 7 in physician's office #airborne
text.text: Measles outbreak in a pediatric practice: airborne transmission in an office setting. The study goes on to warn of modern office buildings having recirculated air

media.caption: A man who spent one night at Hong Kong's Metropole Hotel (left) spread SARS to other ninth floor guests

text.headline: Metropole Hotel 2003 (SARS)
text.text: [Study] 21 infected by one guest who vomited in a corridor. Excerpt: ... At the time, it was not clear if the causative agent was being transmitted by airborne particles, as measles and tuberculosis spread ...
